    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM       http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:openlearn.open.ac.uk:D319_1</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>LearningSpace</catalog>
            <entry>D319_1</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en-gb">Economics explains discrimination in the labour market</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Volkswirtschaft erklärt Unterscheidung im 
Arbeitsmarkt</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les sciences économiques expliquent la 
discrimination sur le marché du travail</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A economia explica a discriminação no mercado 
labour</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">L'economia spiega la distinzione nel mercato di 
lavoro</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τα οικονομικά εξηγούν τη διάκριση στην αγορά εργασίας</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La economía explica la discriminación en el 
mercado de trabajo</string>
          </title>
          <language>en-gb</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en-gb">Discrimination in the labour market exists in many forms: the ‘glass ceiling’ ageism, racism, etc. This unit will help you look at this problem with a new perspective: through economics. You will learn how economists have tried to understand what drives this distortion of the labour market and why women and the ethnic minorities seem to suffer the most.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Society</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Disadvantage</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Discrimination</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Economics</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Economic_theory</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Economists</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Labour_market</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Microeconomics</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en-gb">Segmentation</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>linear</value>
          </structure>
          <aggregationLevel>
            <source>aggregationLevelValues</source>
            <value>2</value>
          </aggregationLevel>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Unterscheidung im Arbeitsmarkt existiert in 
vielen Formen: die?glass Decke? ageism, Rassismus, usw.. 
Diese Maßeinheit hilft Ihnen, dieses Problem mit einer neuen 
Perspektive zu betrachten: durch Volkswirtschaft. Sie 
erlernen, wie Wirtschaftswissenschaftler versucht haben, zu verstehen,
was diese Verzerrung des Arbeitsmarkts antreibt und warum Frauen und 
die ethnischen Minoritäten scheinen, am meisten zu erleiden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La discrimination sur le marché du travail existe
sous beaucoup de formes : le plafond de ?glass ? ageism, 
racisme, etc... Cette unité vous aidera à regarder ce 
problème avec une nouvelle perspective : par des sciences 
économiques. Vous apprendrez comment les économistes ont 
essayé de comprendre ce que pilote cette déformation du marché du 
travail et pourquoi les femmes et les minorités ethniques semblent 
souffrir plus.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A discriminação no mercado labour existe em 
muitos formulários: o teto dos?glass? ageism, racism, 
etc.. Esta unidade ajudar-lhe-á olhar este problema com um 
perspective novo: com a economia. Você aprenderá como os
economistas tentaram compreender o que dirige esta distorção do 
mercado labour e porque as mulheres e os minorities étnicos parecem 
sofrer mais.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">La distinzione nel mercato di lavoro esiste 
in molte forme: il soffitto dei?glass? ageism, razzismo, 
ecc. Questa unità li aiuterà a guardare questo problema con 
una nuova prospettiva: con economia. Imparerete come gli 
economisti hanno provato a capire che cosa guida questa distorsione 
del mercato di lavoro e perchè le donne e le minoranze etniche 
sembrano soffrire più.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Η διάκριση στην αγορά εργασίας υπάρχει με πολλές 
μορφές: το ανώτατο όριο ?glass; ageism, 
ρατσισμός, κ.λπ.... Αυτή η μονάδα θα σας βοηθήσει να 
εξετάσετε αυτό το πρόβλημα με μια νέα προοπτική: μέσω των 
οικονομικών. Θα μάθετε πώς οι οικονομολόγοι έχουν 
προσπαθήσει να καταλάβουν τι οδηγεί αυτήν την διαστρέβλωση της 
αγοράς εργασίας και γιατί οι γυναίκες και οι εθνικές μειονότητες
φαίνονται να υφίστανται πιό πολύ.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La discriminación en el mercado de trabajo existe
en muchas formas: ¿el techo de los?glass? ageism, racismo,
etc. Esta unidad le ayudará a mirar este problema con una nueva
perspectiva: con la economía. Usted aprenderá cómo los 
economistas han intentado entender lo que conduce esta distorsión del
mercado de trabajo y porqué las mujeres y las minorías étnicas se 
parecen sufrir más.</string>
          </description>
